sentences.en: A program whose inntial success had been the source of his first national prominence in 1977.
sentences.cn: 因为靠这个方法的成功,他才能得以在1977年在全国首次显露头角.

sentences.en: a young actor who has recently risen to prominence
sentences.cn: 最近崭露头角的一名年轻演员

sentences.en: An item of prominence on the conference agenda was infant health care.
sentences.cn: 会议议程上的一项重要议题是婴儿保健.

sentences.en: Crime prevention had to be given more prominence.
sentences.cn: 防止犯罪方面应当受到更多的重视。

sentences.en: Delete what is dispensable and give more prominence to the essentials.
sentences.cn: 可以不说的去掉,该说的就可以更突出.

sentences.en: From this atmosphere, great flamelike prominence somitimes extends out into space.
sentences.cn: 有时, 很大的象火焰般的日珥从这个大气野伸展到空间.

sentences.en: He came to prominence during the World Cup in Italy.
sentences.cn: 他在意大利的世界杯赛中声名鹊起。

sentences.en: He came to prominence during the World Cup.
sentences.cn: 他在该世界杯期间一举成名。

sentences.en: He had seen it grow from insignificance to prominence.
sentences.cn: 他眼看它从默默无闻变为赫赫有名.

sentences.en: He has that prominence no longer.
sentences.cn: 他不再拥有那种卓越的地位.

sentences.en: I was only a private Member of Parliament, but of some prominence.
sentences.cn: 那时我不过是个普通议员, 只是有些名望罢了.

sentences.en: It gives the musicians a place of prominence.
sentences.cn: 这就突出了琴师们的显著地位.

sentences.en: Not only the number of cultivars developed, but also many have the prominence attained.
sentences.cn: 不仅因为品种的数量增加了, 而且许多品种是卓越的.

sentences.en: Temperate forest ecosystems occupy a position of prominence among all ecosystems.
sentences.cn: 温带森林生态系统在所有生态系统中占有优势地位.

sentences.en: The news should be chronicled without undue prominence or headlines.
sentences.cn: 刊载这类消息不应当用过分惹人注目的篇幅或标题.

sentences.en: The newspapers are giving the affair considerable prominence.
sentences.cn: 各报都以相当显着的地位报道了那件事.

words.tran_cn: 突出的，显著的；杰出的；卓越的

trans.tran_en: a part or place that is higher than what is around it
